DOC.HEAD: Former Rector of U.N. University Dead
DOC.TEXT: Soedjatmoko, the former rector of the United Nations University, died Thursday after suffering a stroke in Jogjakarta, Central Java. He was 77. He collapsed after participating in a series of scholarly discussions on society and culture, and was taken to Dr. Sardjito Public Hospital, where he died, the official Antara News Agency said. He was to have spoken at Muhammadiyah University later in the day. Before heading the university, Soedjatmoko was Indonesian ambassador to the United States. The U.N. University, based in Tokyo, is a loose association of scholars who research peace issues and development worldwide. Survivors include his wife and three daughters.
